		Question: where did the iroquois indians come from

answer:

The Iroquois Indians migrated throughout North America. Their Migration Seminars have been documented in the work of the anthropologist Edwin R. Moseley. The Cigarette War showed that the Iroquois had inhabited the southeast side of the present-day St. Lawrence River in the early 11th century. In the 12th century, the Iroquois had expanded their territory, establishing various alliances and trading networks across the Northeast.
